Sir i am done with my api endpoint for project 1 but i did one change in the given test file where we have to edit our api endpoint and test it as mentioned in the project description. I was testing my model but was getting the same response every time even though my model was giving the expected answer to those question when tested separately. I found that in the test file (promptfoo.yaml) the cache is marked as true and because of which whenever i try to run the test file it does not hit my api endpoint and take the old response from the cache. So i changed the cache to false and tried running that test file and got the results as shown below in the image.
image
1861×912 105 KB
In this as you can see for the 2nd test case since i am using the openai model to give the final answer so it is using my context and saying that dashboard will show 11/10, but the expected answer should contain “110”. The problem i am facing is as you can see the url given in my response is same as expected which means my model is picking the right context to answer the question but since i am using openai to make my final answer using this context it is very unlikely that it will say that dashboard will show “110” because this doesn’t make sense. So can you please help me how should i tackle this ? As this is the only test case left.
And also i have added one prompt field in the test file because i was getting warning regarding this missing field again and again. So is it okay ?

Hi Sahil,
Check promptfoo file for
Tools in Data Science
,  you might have mistakenly edited it
Between these two:
value:
https://tds.s-anand.net/#/docker
value:
https://tds.s-anand.net/#/docker
Only the
first one is correct
The
second one has a leading space
, which makes it:
" https://tds.s-anand.net/#/docker"
This will
not match
unless the
output.links
string
also contains the space
, which is unlikely. Promptfoo does
exact string containment
, so:
Correct:
value:
https://tds.s-anand.net/#/docker
Incorrect:
value:
https://tds.s-anand.net/#/docker
# has leading space
Always avoid extra spaces unless they are intentionally part of the string you want to match.

will work without any issues, here are other ways of exporting if you don’t want to make chnages to promtfoo.yaml file.
Getting started | promptfoo
To export your
OpenAI API key
and
OpenAI API base URL
for use with
Promptfoo
, you can do this by setting environment variables in your shell.
1. Set environment variables in your terminal
If you’re using the standard OpenAI API:
export
OPENAI_API_KEY=your-openai-api-key
If you’re using a
custom OpenAI-compatible endpoint
(like Azure OpenAI, or a local proxy):
export
OPENAI_API_BASE=https://your-openai-api-url/v1
2. Or set them in a
.env
file (Promptfoo supports this)
Create a
.env
file in your project directory:
OPENAI_API_KEY=your-openai-api-key
OPENAI_API_BASE=https://your-openai-api-url/v1
Then Promptfoo will automatically load these when you run it.
3. If you’re using
promptfoo eval
from CLI
You can also inline the vars when running:
OPENAI_API_KEY=your-openai-api-key OPENAI_API_BASE=https://your-openai-api-url/v1 promptfoo
eval
Notes:
If you’re using
OpenAI’s default API
, you don’t need to set
OPENAI_API_BASE
— it’s optional and defaults to
https://api.openai.com/v1
.
OPENAI_API_KEY
is required
for authentication.
Kind regards
Thanks

Hi
@24f3004935
There can be multiple reason’s behind problem that you are facing, here is TDS GPT generated response from your screenshot.
From the screenshot, all the cells show this error:
[
FAIL
]
API
call
error
:
Error
:
Request
failed after
4
retries
:
undefined
This means
Promptfoo failed to get a response from the API after 4 attempts
. Here are the most likely causes and how to fix them:
Common Causes & Fixes
1.
API Key not set or invalid
Make sure your
OPENAI_API_KEY
is correctly set.
To test:
echo
$OPENAI_API_KEY
If it’s empty, set it:
export
OPENAI_API_KEY=your-key-here
Or add it in
.env
:
OPENAI_API_KEY=your-key-here
2.
Wrong API URL or custom proxy is down
If you’re using a custom API proxy like
ai-proxy
, check:
echo
$OPENAI_API_BASE
If it’s set to something like
http://127.0.0.1:8000/v1
, make sure:
The server is
running
.
The endpoint
/v1/chat/completions
is accessible.
It actually supports the model you’re calling.
To test:
curl http://127.0.0.1:8000/v1/models
If this fails, the proxy isn’t running or reachable.
3.
Network issues or no internet
Promptfoo retries 4 times if it can’t reach the server. If your network is blocking the request or you’re offline, it’ll fail.
To check:
curl https://api.openai.com/v1/models \
  -H
"Authorization: Bearer
$OPENAI_API_KEY
"
If this hangs or fails, you have a network or firewall issue.
How to Fix (Checklist)
Check
Command/Action
Set API Key
export OPENAI_API_KEY=...
Set API Base (if needed)
export OPENAI_API_BASE=https://api.openai.com/v1
Check if proxy is reachable
curl http://127.0.0.1:8000/v1/models
Test API key works
Use curl to OpenAI’s endpoint as shown above
Add
.env
file if using Promptfoo UI
.env
with
OPENAI_API_KEY=...
inside project folder

Hi everyone!
Here’s a quick overview of how the
project evaluation
process will work — both
before
and
after
the deadline:
Before the Deadline (Self-Evaluation)
We’ve provided a
promptfoo.yml
file containing
4 test cases
to help you self-evaluate your API responses.
You can run these tests
locally
to check how well your API is handling the inputs.
You’re
encouraged to add more test cases
to the file and validate your logic thoroughly before submission.
These tests are for
your own practice
— they will not be used during final grading.
After the Deadline (Final Evaluation)
Once submissions close, we will conduct an
automated evaluation
on your
submitted API endpoint
(not your local machine).
We will test your deployed or exposed API using
10 evaluation questions
.
The evaluation will be performed from our side — so make sure your API is
accessible
,
reliable
, and returns
well-formatted
responses.
You don’t need to run any evaluation scripts after submission — we will directly call your endpoint with the test prompts.
Summary
Phase
What You Do
Tool Used
Before deadline
Self-test using and extending
promptfoo.yml
Promptfoo (local)
After deadline
We test your API with 10 questions
Promptfoo (our end)
If you face any issues running the Promptfoo tests locally, or need help exposing your API for evaluation, feel free to post your questions here. We’re here to help!

Hi
@Karvy
Image can be any type of image that are on discourse.
There is way to handle images for processing(resizing, etc) via identifying mime-type from file headers that come through post request.
To identify the
MIME type
of the image sent in the request, you need to:
Step 1: Decode the base64 string
The incoming
image
field in the request JSON is a
base64-encoded image
, like this:
"image"
:
"data of base64..."
On the server side (e.g., in Python), you’ll first
decode the base64 string
.
Step 2: Inspect the raw bytes to get MIME type
There are a few ways to do this depending on your server stack. Below is a method using
Python
:
Python Code Example (for FastAPI, Flask, Django etc.)
import
base64
import
imghdr
import
mimetypes
from
io
import
BytesIO
def
get_image_mimetype
(
base64_string
):
# Decode base64 string

Before you create a new post,
review the existing threads
to see if there are already highly similar or identical postings. Discourse will suggest similar posts once you start typing titles
Tag the post appropriately

,

h

h
prime number”
Type in your question and explanations
rather than pasting images or screenshots.

icon on the post. Please do mention the reason why you are flagging the topic.

The flagged posts that violates forum rules/guidelines will be hidden. Repeated violation of the rules can result in the offender being removal from the forum.

Hey guys, thank you everyone for voicing out your opinions and perspective in a healthy manner. I really appreciate it. I understand it might start to sound like greek and latin for some of you, but we intentionally made the decision to have ML foundations as co-requisite. Because you can learn the theory and try to visit back and connect with the practice (tools) part. Some pointers which could be helpful for all of you having different perspectives (both positive and negative) -
What is the benefit of this course? - passing this course would definitely make you industry ready. And Anand S, who himself is a very accomplished Data Scientist wanted to give the real flavour of how you would be working in Industry (no spoon-feeding, but giving you directions). Most examinations will be open book, open internet or take home.
We will share all the resources (codes, excel, etc.). You can download those supplementary materials from the drive link in course contents page.
There will be youtube live sessions every week and the calendar will be shared soon. Please used these live sessions if you need more help or guidance.
All the instructors in this course are well accomplished data scientists working in industry and most of them also teach in different IITs/IIMs as faculty. So my humble request is to give them all a bit of respect as some of you are bluntly rude.
Definitely this course will be different from other courses because this is going to be an applied course and the idea is to make you know the different quantum of things we could do in data science. I do not think you would be Industry ready unless you get comfortable with this course honestly. Because this is the reality, this is how things are going to be once you interview for or get onboarded as DS.
The materials and case studies are so meticulously curated just for the purpose this course in the past 8 months. They are so valuable and try to explore use the help of live sessions to get your issues sorted out.
Use the Youtube live sessions to the fullest those whoever need more help with this course. We would be more than happy to help. Let’s respect each other and that’s a fair expectation I guess. Thanks!

session.headers.update(HEADERS)
session.cookies.update(COOKIES)

carlton
Regular
23d
this is very good reason to work in wsl instead of directly on your local machine. git bash I presume is a direct install on windows (a bash terminal for windows). bash is a very powerful tool and has to be used with care. unless you really know what you are doing, it is far better to work in isolated VMs like wsl or other similar setups or containers. It may be recoverable, but for future make sure you have regular backups of your work in the cloud like on OneDrive or Google Drive. Then recovery from fatal erasures is trivial.
As far as how to recover the files totally depends on what happened and if you have any recovery systems in place. It is hard to give generic advice without knowing your system. If there is Roll back or File History in your system it is quite possible to recover the files. Or if your work is all within OneDrive for example.
Kind regards

Try TestDisk.
TestDisk is a tool for recovering files which have been deleted.
Install testdisk
Enter testisk into the command line, and the utility will start.
Select your partition to search in.
Select quick search or deeper search.
testdisk will output which files have been recovered and then you can decide to recover or not.
A tutorial on testdisk at the following link,
How to Install TestDisk on Linux and Recover Deleted Files | DigitalOcean
Also available on Windows, don’t know the steps though.

You can use the AI Pipe Token from
aipipe.org/login
in any OpenAI API compatible application by setting:
OPENAI_API_KEY as your AI Pipe Token
OPENAI_BASE_URL as
https://aipipe.org/openai/v1
eg. (in Linux BASH)
export
OPENAI_API_KEY=your_aipipe_token_goes_here
export
OPENAI_BASE_URL=
"https://aipipe.org/openai/v1"
Then if you have
uv
installed
Note:
The tool previously named
uvx
is now
uvenv
due to a naming collision with a new
uv
command. The new name better reflects its purpose, combining
uv
with
venv
.
It’s been used here so that those who are familiar with
uvx
can understand the below command. It is always good practise to migrate away from deprecated tools to newer maintained ones because deprecated tools are easy targets of open-source supply chain code injection attacks.
uvx
is not the same as the python library uvx.
uvx
here is a command within uv.
uvx openai api chat.completions.create -m gpt-4.1-nano -g user
"Hello. Give me 5 names for a pet dog."
or
uvx llm
'Hello. What is 2 + 2?'
-m gpt-4.1-nano --key
$OPENAI_API_KEY

uv
command. The new name better reflects its purpose, combining
uv
with
venv
.
It’s been used here so that those who are familiar with
uvx
can understand the below command. It is always good practise to migrate away from deprecated tools to newer maintained ones because deprecated tools are easy targets of open-source supply chain code injection attacks.

is not the same as the python library uvx.
uvx

uvx openai api chat.completions.create -m gpt-4.1-nano -g user

Your scores are evaluated on a site that is external to the seek portal and is not integrated with the seek portal. Therefore seek does not know if you have submitted or not and by default says that it has not been submitted because it cannot see your external evaluation. There will not be a fix for this for some time.
Scores for GA1, GA2, GA3, GA4, GA5, Project1, Project2, ROE will NOT be inside your seek portal.
The scores will only be visible in the dashboard.
Just ignore anything inside seek portal. The dashboard is where all your subject score cards exists.
As stated in multiple places on discourse as well as in live sessions, The final score is always your last submission. If your dashboard score does not match your final submission score on the assignment page, only then contact us regarding your marks.
Kind regards

carlton
Regular
1
Feb 6
Your scores are evaluated on a site that is external to the seek portal and is not integrated with the seek portal. Therefore seek does not know if you have submitted or not and by default says that it has not been submitted because it cannot see your external evaluation. There will not be a fix for this for some time.
Scores for GA1, GA2, GA3, GA4, GA5, Project1, Project2, ROE will NOT be inside your seek portal.
The scores will only be visible in the dashboard.
Just ignore anything inside seek portal. The dashboard is where all your subject score cards exists.
As stated in multiple places on discourse as well as in live sessions, The final score is always your last submission. If your dashboard score does not match your final submission score on the assignment page, only then contact us regarding your marks.
Kind regards

Hi Satish,
Your last submitted score is the only valid score. You have to check before submitting that the score is correct. There is a reload button to load previous answers. But some answers require a live service. If the live service is not running at the time of the check (when you hit the submit button), you will not be scored for those questions. Please make sure that you have any live services running when the submit button is used and check that the last saved score is correct.
Kind regards
